description.narrative: Output 1.6: District-level authorities incorporate risk and vulnerability assessment into local planning methodologies to improve needs-focused services for the most vulnerable children and adolescents an families and to support resilience, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Disaster Risk Reduction, Disaster Risk Reduction (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Families with children, adolescents, and young people living close to or below the national subsistence minimum are more resilient (to economic and social deprivation, and stress) and they benefit more from equitable access to quality and inclusive social services and transfers

participating-org.narrative: CENTER FOR EMERGENCY SITUATIONS AND DISASTER RISK REDUCTION

sector.narrative: Disaster risk reduction (including linkage to climate change)
Risk assessment and analysis (including conflict, disaster, climate, epidemics)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.6: District-level authorities incorporate risk and vulnerability assessment into local planning methodologies to improve needs-focused services for the most vulnerable children and adolescents an families and to support resilience

description.narrative: The methodology on child-centered disaster risk analysis was costed and promoted for the national scale-up | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of oblasts and municipalities which have incorporated risk analysis and disaster risk reduction into local development programmes

Status of UNICEF response and recovery efforts to COVID-19 in meeting organizational benchmarks on risk-informed programming and peaceful inclusive societies for a resilient and child-centered response and recovery that aims to build back better and greener (Yes/No) [COVID] iii) Supporting national and/or local actors to strengthen resilience and disaster risk reduction systems and capacities as part COVID-19 response and long-term recovery efforts.
